title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 May 2017 - XWiki
content:
<slayerjain> has quit  
01:38 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
02:15 <cjd> has quit  
07:43 <simfir> has quit  
07:44 <simfir> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <VincentMassol[m]> it'es strnage since mvn dependency:list-repositories  lists the repo  
10:40 <tmortagne[m]> try putting the repository in the pom  
10:40 <VincentMassol[m]> and the profile is activated  
10:40 <tmortagne[m]> see https://bitbucket.org/axelclk/info.bliki.wiki/wiki/Home#markdown-header-using-snapshots  
10:40 <VincentMassol[m]> what's very strange is that this repo is listed first in the settings.xml  
10:40 <tmortagne[m]> bliki has a tendency to never release anything and just use snapshots...  
10:40 <VincentMassol[m]> yeah was about to do that  
10:43 <VincentMassol[m]> very weird, same problem  
10:43 <tmortagne[m]> which version of Maven is this ?  
10:44 <VincentMassol[m]> 3.5.0  
10:44 <tmortagne[m]> try removing them from your local repo, never knows...  
10:44 <VincentMassol[m]> they're not there  
10:44 <tmortagne[m]> the jar are not  
10:44 <VincentMassol[m]> since I never got them  
10:44 <tmortagne[m]> but Maven created a skeleton  
10:45 <VincentMassol[m]> I can try this  
10:45 <tmortagne[m]> (or actually Aether did)  
10:45 <tmortagne[m]> or in case of Maven 3.5 the new thing  
10:45 <VincentMassol[m]> got to go take my train back to france, bb later, thanks  
10:46 <tmortagne[m]> also maybe it's some weird Maven 3.5 bug, last time I used this repo it was with 3.3.9  
10:53 <slayerjain[m]> has left #xwiki  
10:55 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <tmortagne[m]> Enygma: Hi, did you have a look at failing test in UndeleteActionTest ?  
10:56 <tmortagne[m]> \*tests  
11:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <ClmentAubin[m]> Hi everyone !  
11:29 <ClmentAubin[m]> I’m currently trying to fix flickering tests in xwiki-platform-extension, but I need to make changes in xwiki-platform-test-ui for debugging purposes. Is there any way to override the maven dependency in xwiki-platform-extension-test-tests in order to use my modified version of xwiki-platform-test-ui during functionnal tests ?  
11:31 <tmortagne[m]> caubin: just build xwiki-platform-test-ui with mvn install which will put a new version in your local repository  
11:31 <tmortagne[m]> when you build xwiki-platform-test-ui it's using the most recent jar it can find  
11:32 <tmortagne[m]> a usually easier way to deal with that is to run your test from your EDI and import both projects  
11:33 <ClmentAubin[m]> Ok, I will try that, thanks  
11:34 <tmortagne[m]> what I usually do when debugging a test: run the XWiki instance generated by the test project when run with Maven, from Eclipse debug the test  
11:34 <tmortagne[m]> it will automatically start Firefox and use the currently running instance of XWiki  
11:38 <Enygma`> tmortagne (@tmortagne:matrix.xwiki.com): plan for today  
11:42 <tmortagne[m]> ok  
12:14 <VincentMassol[m]> ok I'm now in the train to Paris. Seems to be working now after 1) cleaning my local repo (not sure it did something) and 2) adding a <pluginReopository> entry instead of <repository> in my pom.xml. Still don't understand why it doidn't work with my settings.xml (I'll clean up and retry once I'm on a good connexion because downloading all jars in the train is not working that well ;))

17:25 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:39 <floflobel> Hello, how do I zip files into v2.0 to create a XAR? I noticed that a simple zip was in version 1.0 and the import does not work..  
17:40 <VincentMassol[m]> floflobel: a XAR is not just a zip  
17:40 <VincentMassol[m]> if you're using maven then the simplest is to create a maven project for them as we do (and use the xwiki maven xar plugin)  
17:41 <VincentMassol[m]> if you want to do it by hand here's a link to the spec:  
17:41 <VincentMassol[m]> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XAR%20Module%20Specifications  
17:48 <VincentMassol[m]> mflorea/all: seems we have checkstyle error in platform:  
17:48 <VincentMassol[m]> [INFO] There is 1 error reported by Checkstyle 7.7 with checkstyle.xml ruleset.  
17:48 <VincentMassol[m]> [ERROR] src/main/java/org/xwiki/gwt/wysiwyg/client/plugin/link/exec/LinkExecutableUtils.java:[64,5] (metrics) NPathComplexity: NPath Complexity is 216 (max allowed is 200).  
17:50 <VincentMassol[m]> maybe someone upgraded checkstyle or changed the config?  
17:51 <VincentMassol[m]> I wonder why ci.xwiki.org doesn't have it though....  
17:51 <floflobel> VincentMassol [m]: I export the XAR file from my wiki, I change values in the xml file, I zip all the files and when I try to import the new XAR is empty  
17:52 <tmortagne[m]> vmassol: we don't see it in platform because xwiki-platform\_Quality is stuck with a jacoco issue Enygma did not fixed yet I think  
17:52 <tmortagne[m]> I upgraded checkstyle a few days ago  
17:52 <VincentMassol[m]> ah yes I forgot we moved checkstyle to quality profile  
17:53 <VincentMassol[m]> (I don't like that too much, too easy to break IMO)  
17:53 <VincentMassol[m]> (I mean devs need to rememer to always build with -Pquality)  
17:53 <VincentMassol[m]> \*remember  
17:53 <tmortagne[m]> I always build with -Pquality  
17:53 <VincentMassol[m]> I don't  
17:54 <tmortagne[m]> but checkstyle is not really linked to quality profile AFAIK  
17:54 <tmortagne[m]> it's just disabled in platform jenkins job  
17:54 <VincentMassol[m]> it's a separate job?  
17:54 <tmortagne[m]> so that we have those only in quality job  
17:54 <VincentMassol[m]> ok  
17:54 <VincentMassol[m]> good  
17:54 <tmortagne[m]> there was no reason to block everyone for a checkstyle error  
17:55 <VincentMassol[m]> ideally we'd need "unbreakable build"  
17:55 <VincentMassol[m]> it shouldn't be too hard to implement with jenkins pipeline now  
17:56 <VincentMassol[m]> a solution could be to commit to trunk but release from a release branch and the CI would merge a commit on the release branch when everything passes  
17:58 <VincentMassol[m]> hmm wouldn't work for the use case at hand actually  
17:59 <VincentMassol[m]> since if devs are on master then they'd still get the breakages  
17:59 <VincentMassol[m]> need to think more about how to implmeent this with our tools ;)  
18:04 <VincentMassol[m]> tmortagne (@tmortagne:matrix.xwiki.com): so what do you want to do about the CS 7.7 violations?  
18:04 <VincentMassol[m]> tmortagne (@tmortagne:matrix.xwiki.com): so what do you want to do about the CS 7.7 violation?  
18:05 <VincentMassol[m]> we can either a) configure it to behave as before or b) agree to use the new default and fix the code  
18:05 <VincentMassol[m]> btw it would be nice to run chckstyle on platform when we upgrade CS  
18:05 <VincentMassol[m]> (before committing the upgrade)
